Photos.Controller

Class AlbumController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Photos.Controller.Controller
      • Photos.Controller.AlbumController

  • public class AlbumController
extends Controller
    Controller that handles the Album view, which displays the list of albums of the currently logged in user. Allows the user to add, search, delete, and open albums, and logout.
    Author:
    Krysti Leong, April Dizon

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Photos.Controller.Controller

      • initData

        protected void initData(User currentUser,
                        Album currentAlbum,
                        Database db)
        Set the data and show it on the screen!
        Specified by:
        initData in class Controller
        Parameters:
        currentUser - Current user in this session, if any.
        currentAlbum - Current selected album in this session, if any.
        db - Current database of this session, if any.

      • handleAdd

        public void handleAdd(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        Handle the add button an attempt to add a new album to this user's account. Shows a dialog to get the album name, and makes sure that this name is not a duplicate of another album name. Any errors are displayed for the user in a dialog popup.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Action event of the add button click.

      • handleEdit

        public void handleEdit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent,
                       Album album)
        Edit the name of the album.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - Action event of the button click.
        album - Album to edit.

      • handleView

        public void handleView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent,
                       Album album)
        Handle the open/view action on an album. Takes the user to the photo scene.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - ActionEvent of the button click.
        album - Album that was chosen.

      • handleDelete

        public void handleDelete(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent,
                         Album album)
        Handles when the user wants to delete an album. Any errors are shown in a dialog popup.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - ActionEvent of this button
        album - The Album to be deleted.
